Class Paragraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • content.Element
      • content.Paragraph

  • public class Paragraph
extends Element
    Author:
    Bruno Quercia A paragraph is an Element that contains runs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Paragraph()
      Creates an empty Paragraph
      Paragraph(java.util.LinkedList<Run> runs)
      Creates a Paragraph containing given Runs

      Creates a Paragraph containing a given text

    • Method Detail

      • getRuns

        public java.util.LinkedList<Run> getRuns()
        Returns:
        the Runs that compose the Paragraph

      • setRuns

        public void setRuns(java.util.LinkedList<Run> runs)
        Sets the list of runs composing the Paragraph. All pre-existing runs will be erased.
        Parameters:
        runs - the runs that will now compose the Paragraph.

      • addRun

        Adds a new run to the Paragraph
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        success

      • removeRun

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        success
